pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.11: According to [Sp.2.615]() _khajjaka_ refers to all fresh foods: _Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ_, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.13: According to [Vin-vn-ṭ.1907]() _uttaribhaṅga_ is just another word for _byañjana_: _uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ_. _Byañjana_ seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean-curries, which are called _sūpa_.
